channel.title: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
channel.description: I get this error: [img]http://static.raymond.cc/images/setup-did-not-find-any-hard-disk.png[/img] I Do Have a hard drive in this laptop (only about 50gb) but it can't be read How do I resolve this?

item.title: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The BIOS are accessed in the System Setup screen, so you were pretty much on the right track. Could you take a picture of what the screen looks like? Obviously you’ll have to use external hard ware like a legitimate camera to take a picture.

Read full topic
item.source: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp

item.title: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Wow that is a pretty old computer you got their…

I suggest you bring the computer to a computer store and ask them to see what the problem is.

Read full topic
item.source: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp

item.title: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

How do I get to the Bios screen if this keeps showing up
o Bootable CD In ATAPI CD-ROM

Intel UNDI, PXE-2.0 (build 082)
Copyright © 1997-2000 Intel Corporation

For Realtek RTL8139(X)/8130/810x PCI Fast Ethernet Controller v2.13 (020326)
PXE-E61: Media test failure, check cable
PXE-MOF: Exiting PXE ROM.
Press any key when ready…
and when it starts up
i quickly tap f2
the system setup shows up
It says
Built in HDD
= No drive
Built in ODD = Secondary IDE (170M/IRQ15)
Bios version = 1.90

Read full topic
item.source: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp

item.title: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Check the BIOS and make sure it’s being picked up and enabled.

Read full topic
item.source: Hard disk error on my old laptop installing Xp
